articles.title: Organic farmers find fertile ground in North Africa - News24
articles.description: Proudly displaying her freshly picked pomegranates, Tunisian farmer Sarah Shili says going organic is "the future of farming" -- and as demand surges in North Africa and beyond, the sector is blooming.
articles.content:
• In 2001, just 16,000 hectares in Tunisia were dedicated to organic farming — a figure that has multiplied 20-fold over two decades.
